name: oauth
comment: A convinience library providing both client and server support for OAuth 1.0a.

generateParameters.name: generateParameters
generateParameters.comment: Generate the parameters to be included in the Authorization: header of a request. Generally you should prefer use of oauth/oauth.signRequest or oauth/oauth.Client

produceAuthorizationHeader.name: produceAuthorizationHeader
produceAuthorizationHeader.comment: Produces a correctly formatted Authorization header given a parameter map

signRequest.name: signRequest
signRequest.comment:
Signs oauth/oauth.signRequest.request using consumer token oauth/oauth.signRequest.consumerToken and user authorization oauth/oauth.signRequest.userToken

If the body of oauth/oauth.signRequest.request has content type application/x-www-form-urlencoded, then the request body cannot be streaming as the body parameters are required as part of the signature.

The combination of oauth/oauth.signRequest.consumerToken, oauth/oauth.signRequest.userToken, oauth/oauth.signRequest.nonce and oauth/oauth.signRequest.timestamp must be unique. oauth/oauth.signRequest.timestamp must be specified in Unix time format (i.e. seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00Z)

isAuthorized.name: isAuthorized
isAuthorized.comment:
Validates that the request contains a valid OAuth signature.

The request parameters will be validated, and then oauth/oauth.isAuthorized.tokenFinder will be invoked in order to look up the secrets(s) associated with the request. Finally, the signature will be computed and compared to the passed value to ensure that the request is to be authorized.

oauth/oauth.isAuthorized.timestampLeeway may be specified, which determines the maximum difference permitted between the request timestamp and the present time. The default value is 10 minutes. You should not vary this value across multiple requests as doing so may permit request replay attacks.

Returns whether the request should be permitted.

class.name: Client
class.preview: An implementation of oauth/oauth.BaseClient which signs all requests with the provided credentials.

class.name: Token
class.preview: Bundles together the public and secret portions of an OAuth token.

TokenFinder.name: TokenFinder
TokenFinder.comment:
Invoked by isAuthorized in order to look up the tokens for a request

If the oauth_token authorization header parameter was missing, the empty string will be passed as userKey. In this case, it is expected that TokenPair.user will be null in the returned TokenPair.
TokenFinder.preview: Invoked by isAuthorized in order to look up the tokens for a request

NonceQuery.name: NonceQuery
NonceQuery.comment:
Invoked by isAuthorized in order to validate the non-reuse of the request nonce.

Per the OAuth specification, the combination of nonce, consumer key, user token key and nonce must be unique per distinct timestamp.

Instead of the timestamp, this library passes the point in time at which the signature will expire, based upon the timestampLeeway parameter passed to isAuthorized. Therefore, there is a 1:1 mapping between request timestamps and values passed to this function.

The expiry value is computed as the timestamp passed in the request plus two times the timestampLeeway value, in order to avoid risk of attack due to server clock skew.

The implementation should look up the combination of the parameters in a database to ensure they have not already been used. Following this, it should insert the values of the passed parameters into a database to prevent token reuse.

The implementation should implement a process which periodically sweeps expired nonce values from the database.
NonceQuery.preview: Invoked by isAuthorized in order to validate the non-reuse of the request nonce.

packageIntro:
An implementation of OAuth 1.0a, as per RFC 5849.

The client portion is designed for use with the http package. The server portion is designed to work with the dart:io HttpServer class.

Supports only HMAC-SHA1 signatures. In practice, RSA-SHA1 signatures are rare and most users have switched to OAuth 2. PLAINTEXT signatures are also not supported, and hopefully less common.

Comes with a test suite. Please report any incompatibility issues.
